title: Structural Equation Modeling-Based Instructional Design to Improve Psychological Processes and Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced expertise in language education and foundational knowledge of learning psychology
context.additional_context: Customized design for strengthening language education competencies among current practitioners. Structural equation modeling analysis of the impact of social experiences and personal beliefs on learning outcomes

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three elements of psychological processes (personal commitment, effective functioning, personal effort) to actual language learning situations.
Learners analyze and visualize causal relationships between social experiences and learning outcomes using structural equation modeling.
Learners design and implement personalized learning strategies utilizing psychological processes through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
